alert.note: Alert for Carter; Coal; Garvin; Hughes; Jefferson; Johnston; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Seminole; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 9:31PM CST until February 26 at 10:15PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Jefferson County in southern Oklahoma... Garvin County in southern Oklahoma... Northwestern Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southern Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Eastern Stephens County in southern Oklahoma... Central Carter County in southern Oklahoma... Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Murray County in southern Oklahoma... Southwestern Hughes County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern McClain County in central Oklahoma... * Until 1015 PM CST. * At 931 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Criner to 6 miles north of Velma to 5 miles east of Addington, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Ada, Pauls Valley, Sulphur, Davis, Lone Grove, Healdton, Wynnewood, Stratford, Maysville, Byng, Allen, Roff, Springer, Elmore City, Velma, Paoli, Ravia, Stonewall and Katie. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Carter; Coal; Garvin; Hughes; Jefferson; Johnston; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Seminole; Stephens
